Package com.cvut.fel.pjv.Utilities

Class ValidationHelper

java.lang.Object
com.cvut.fel.pjv.Utilities.ValidationHelper
public class ValidationHelper extends Object
The ValidationHelper class provides methods for validating moves and checking game rules. It assists in determining the legality of moves, checking for winners, and handling various game states. This class contains methods for validating the legality of moves, including push and pull operations, checking for winners based on specific game conditions, and managing the state of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • ValidationHelper

      public ValidationHelper(GameController game, Board board)
      Constructs a ValidationHelper object with the specified game controller and board.
      Parameters:
      game - The GameController instance controlling the game.
      board - The Board instance representing the game board.

  • Method Details

    • checkIfMoveValid

      public boolean checkIfMoveValid(int[] oldPos, int[] newPos, Colors whoseTurn, int turnsSoFar, boolean aiCheck)
      Checks if the move from the old position to the new position is valid. This method verifies if the move adheres to the game's rules and restrictions.
      Parameters:
      oldPos - The coordinates of the piece's old position.
      newPos - The coordinates of the piece's new position.
      whoseTurn - The color of the player whose turn it is.
      turnsSoFar - The number of turns elapsed in the current turn.
      aiCheck - A flag indicating whether the move validation is for an AI player.
      Returns:
      True if the move is valid, otherwise false.

    • freezing

      private boolean freezing(int row, int col, Colors whoseTurn)
      Checks if the specified position is frozen, if a stronger enemy piece is nearby.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the position to check.
      col - The column index of the position to check.
      whoseTurn - The color of the player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      True if the position is frozen, otherwise false.

    • validateEndTurn

      public boolean validateEndTurn()
      Validates the end of a player's turn. This method verifies if the current game state allows ending the player's turn.
      Returns:
      True if the turn can be ended, otherwise false.

    • trap

      public String trap()
      Determines if there is a trapped piece on the game board.
      Returns:
      A string representing the position of the trapped piece, or an empty string if no trap exists.

    • checkWinner

      public Colors checkWinner(Colors whoseTurn)
      Checks for a winner based on the current game state. This method examines the board to determine if a winning condition has been met by either player.
      Parameters:
      whoseTurn - The color of the player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      The color of the winning player, or null if no winner has been determined yet.

    • canBePushed

      private boolean canBePushed(int row, int col, Figures myFig, Figures opponentsFig, Colors opponentsColor, Colors myColor)
      Determines if a piece at the specified position can be pushed by an opponent's piece.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the position to check.
      col - The column index of the position to check.
      myFig - The figure type of the player's piece.
      opponentsFig - The figure type of the opponent's piece.
      opponentsColor - The color of the opponent's piece.
      myColor - The color of the player's piece.
      Returns:
      True if the piece can be pushed, otherwise false.

    • returnToState

      public void returnToState(State state)
      Reverts the validation helper to a previous game state. This method restores the validation helper's state to a previously saved state.
      Parameters:
      state - The State object representing the previous game state to return to.
